intro: Euphorbia benoistii, commonly known as the Benoist's spurge, is a succulent plant native to Madagascar. It features a cylindrical stem covered in soft, greenish-gray hairs and produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant has a shallow root system and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for xeriscaping.
